intro: Cryptandra miliaris, commonly known as the small-flowered cryptandra, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has small, narrow leaves and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Cryptandra miliaris is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
